data.title: La Veranda yummy and friendly
data.text: We stopped in for a drink and an appetizer.  Johnny visited with us.  We had a fig appetizer and it was great.  Nice cocktails too.   We had to have a cocktail for medicinal reasons after a hectic drive back from SF.  We were visitors to the area.

data.title: The BEST...
data.text:
We had the great fortune of visiting this fabulous restaurant twice in the same day.  Once when we ventured in for a drink before a rehearsal dinner, and later during a rehearsal dinner extravaganza that evening.  When we first arrived, we were greeted by the friendliest bartender who turned out to be the owner of the place.  Within moments of arriving we felt so welcome we didn't want to leave to change and return for the rehearsal dinner.  The buffet style dinner they prepared was amazing.  Great food, unbelievable service, and again, the hands on owner, his amazing staff, and his family who all must work there kept the food and drinks and excellent service at a high level to a very demanding crowd all evening.   I can only imagine how amazing this place is on a regular night.  If we're in the area again anytime soon, we will definitely find out.  

Five big stars for this gem of restaurant.

data.title: I'm Italian and this is my favorite in East County
data.text:
From the Antipasto Misto to the Tiramisu all have been delicious. I've never had a bad entre there. The specials are always great to try. Chicken Saltimbocca or Marsalla are a good go to. Polenta is a great choice over the potatoes.
They're a great family and the owner Johnny makes some really special drinks.
Enjoy!
Ciao!

data.title: A bit pricey but food is almost always well prepared.  Service is spotty.
data.text: Great location close to the waterfront.  Italian cuisine with occasional service to include lamb dishes which are hard to find in this town.  May seem expensive but not in comparison to other specialty restaraunts in this area.

data.title: Just okay...
data.text: You won't have a tough time getting seated here, so don't worry about reservations. Service was good, but food was a solid 2/5. Wine list was not impressive.

data.title: nice place to eat
data.text: This is a very nice restaurant in downtown Pittsburg. Great place to go before or after a show at the California theater.

data.title: Great Lunch & Dinner
data.text: Have been here twice. The first visit was for lunch. Both dishes were excellent!! Decided then to come beck for dinner with other friends and once again we were very pleased with both the food and the service.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Some of the best food and service in Pittsburg. Beautiful restaurant and awesome food. The Lamb chops with a pomegranate reduction sauce is my new favorite there. Fresh oysters are always good there. You can't miss with any dessert there.

data.title: great place
data.text: the food is good, the atmosphere, is great, great deals for lunch. dinners are good, very small quint place, downtown Pittsburg, CA by the river

data.title: Nice little spot in Pittsburg
data.text: Had dinner here recently and was pleasantly surprised by the food and atmosphere. I had the marghetria pizza which was very good. The prices were also very reasonable.

data.title: Great dinner
data.text: I took my wife and another couple here for dinner. It was outstanding, the service was great and the food was even better than expected. One very nice thing the owner came to our table to make sure our food was what we were expecting it should be. But my favorite thing is that they carry my brand of Scotch.

data.title: Great Italian Food!
data.text:
Good food and the owner Jonny is great!  Always a delight to go here.  You can dine outside or inside and can take out food.  They also rent out the restaurant for events.  Price of food ranges from $6 - $25 dollars but well worth the money 

Try the lemon raviolis, they are amazing!

data.title: Just Average
data.text: My wife and I went for an early dinner on a weeknight.  There were a few people in the bar area, but no other diners.  The manager was pleasant enough, but when he took our order he forgot to add shrimp to my wife's pasta, as requested.  When we pointed out his mistake, he told the kitchen to grill some shrimp and bring to her.  When they brought the shrimp, it was not grilled and it was barely warm.  Her pasta was slightly undercooked, and my ravioli was good but nothing special.  When the waitress came on duty, she didn't give us much attention; and, we had to interupt her conversation with a coworker to get our check.  Not the best dining experience.

data.title: Good Fresh food
data.text: Liked it so much, went back a second time.  The food was great, a proper portion and reasonably priced.  The service was excellent and will go back again, next time I am in the area.

user_location.name: Goshen Four Corners, New Hampshire, United States

data.title: Perfect Pizza
data.text: We visited this restaurant based on the reviews.  Although the menu had a variety of tempting entrees, we opted for the pizza.  They are meant to be individual pizzas but they are big enough to split.  Everyone has their own pizza preference and this style is mine.  Thin, but not too thin, crust with various toppings.  The beer and wine options are many and not overpriced.  Service was quick and efficient with periodic checks to make sure everything was to our satisfaction.  I will definitely return to try some of the other menu items.

data.title: Amazing Food, Amazing Dessert!
data.text: We tried La Veranda for the first time on Friday (10/23) and were so happily surprised by how delicious EVERYTHING was; from the amazing herbed bread and dipping sauce, to the scrumptious cheese raviolis and lasagna, followed by a delicious creme brûlée and THE best tasting tiramisu I have had!  The cream tasted so homemade, light and airy; everything was blended together to perfection!  Will definitely be going back AND letting everyone know about this gem!

data.title: Great food
data.text: My wife and I really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere of this restaurant. It's been about a year since we have been there and it's still good. We love it!

data.title: Great Food,Historic Area,Enjoy The Delta
data.text: This place is out of the way but worth the trip. We have been there many times and the food is stellar...great Italian/Seafood menu! It's a destination restaurant but just a couple blocks away...you are looking at the beautiful Delta.

data.title: Authentic Italian Food in Downtown Pittsburg, CA
data.text: Choose this restaurant based on a recommendation from the hotel.  Arrived in the area to find a very busy downtown due to a car show, so had to park and then walk a few blocks to access this restaurant.  Bar was very busy due to the downtown activities.  Dining area not so much, however found it interesting that at least 2 male managers/floor leads ignored me for about 5 minutes at the front podium as I waited to be acknowledged and seated.  Once seated the server was attentive and helpful!  She made a few great recommendations and I enjoyed the eggplant and penne pasta.  Generous servings and authenitic Italian flavors.  Bread served was mediocre...kinda of stale with an interesting marinara style dip.  Wine servings were generous also.  Server was attentive throughout the meal.  She is part of the reason for the 4 stars!  Not a memorable meal but appreciate the convenience.

data.title: Try the Salmon Salad!
data.text: I've only eaten here a handful of times and always order the Salmon Salad, which is quite good.  The place is always packed, so I imagine the other choices are a hit as well.
